Honey stared down at the empty plates with a pensive look. His stomach was still gurgling and he definitely wanted more cake...but Mori had been so reluctant to hand over these last three pieces, the odds of him relenting and letting him have more were slim. Suddenly, he heard the twins voices inside his head.

"No one can push you around anymore." He couldn't remember which of them had said it, but it didn't matter. It was the truth! He looked over his bigger body, still growing larger, pushing through the holes in his clothes. He glanced over at Mori who was looking at him with concern. To anyone else, it would have just looked like Mori's normal, passive expression. But Honey knew better. He could read all the little quirks and twitches of his cousin's face to know what he was feeling. Honey wasn't about to hurt Mori or even disobey him if he didn't have to. He looked up at his taller cousin sweetly and said, "Takeshi?~ Can I have just oooooone more piece?~ Pleeeeeease?~"

Mori crossed his arms and tilted his head. "Mitsukuni, I thought we had an agreement. You can only have up to four slices of cake a day. You've had enough."

Honey's expression darkened slightly but his cute smile quickly replaced it. "Aw come on~ Just one more slice can't hurt me, right? I promise I'll be extra good and even floss and use mouth wash without you having to tell me!"

Mori's eyebrow twitched. It was too hard to say no to his cousin...but he had to do what was best for him. "I'm sorry Mitsukuni. I just can't let you."

Honey, still smiling, rose to his feet, staring Mori in the eye. This was enough to break Mori's passive expression, his eyes wide with surprise that his once tiny cousin was now as tall as him! His clothes hung off him in tatters, his massive feet shedding his expensive shoes like they were made of rotten leather, the sides and top of them splitting open like a dried husk. Mori's eyes traveled up Honey's thick calves, diamond hard and jutting out behind him, supporting the huge weight above them. His thighs had ripped open his pants, leaving him with nothing but skin tight black shorts, hints of his bunny boxers visible in the rips and tears. His package, absolutely enormous even for his age, bulged out, nearly touching Mori's own as Honey stepped closer to him. Mori gulped slightly as his gaze continued up Honey's body, taking in his rock hard eight pack, each slab of muscle jutting out from Honey's once flat stomach. Hanging shelf like over top of them was Honey's massive pecs, his button down shirt stretched impossibly across them. It was a miracle the buttons were managing to hold. It seemed like one simple breath would be all it took to burst them all at once! His jacket was ripped clean in half, the once tiny teen's now gigantic back and shoulders making short work of it. Finally, Mori's gaze stopped at the still youthful face...now looming at least a head above him!

"Takeshi..." His voice had dropped slightly lower again, rumbling up from his bellows like chest. "I really want some more cake. Why don't you just bring me whatever is left, okay? And then you can brush my teeth all you want~ That is...if you can reach."

He let out a deep chuckle as Mori gulped again, stepping back. "I...guess I can do that...for you Mitsukuni."

He turned and walked, practically jogged, back to where the cake was, loading the last few pieces onto separate plates again. Honey smiled brightly and sat down again, the chair suddenly snapping under his weight. He crashed to the ground, a look of surprise on his face. Then he laughed and stood back up. "I don't need a chair anyway~"

The twins were watching this whole display, wide eyed and fearful at how absolutely huge Honey looked...and he was still growing! Even now his head inched higher and higher while his muscles bulged thicker and thicker, and his body grew wider and wider! This little trick of theirs was starting to look very dangerous indeed! Where the heck was Kyoya with the data on this?!

"Huh? Tama-chan? What happened to him?"

Lightning fast, the twins were suddenly on either side of the collapsed Tamaki. "Oh he just probably needs something to eat!" Hikaru said, grabbing one of Tamaki's arms.

"Yeah! We'll just get him a snack and some coffee and he'll be fine!"

Honey tilted his head, looking slightly suspicious. "Is that so?"

"Yup! You know how he can get~" Hikaru said, starting to sweat as those eyes glared down at him. "He gets so wrapped up in things he forgets to eat and ends up making himself sick!"

"Too bad Haruhi isn't here to look after him, huh?" Kaoru said with a chuckle.

Honey smiled and said, "Yeah, I guess you're right."

He turned his back on them, walking back over to the table where Mori was setting out the last of the cake for him.

The twins breathed a sigh of relief. When Tamaki had fainted he had luckily landed on top of Usa-chan, covering him from view. If Honey had moved him even slightly, he would have seen the soiled rabbit. It was funny to see Tamaki get flustered and intimidated, but the twins drew the line at watching him get beaten to a bloody pulp! With a quick maneuver, the twins hoisted him up between them, keeping Usa-chan hidden from view the entire time, and carried Tamaki into another room.

Honey, meanwhile, had foregone using a fork completely, stuffing the cake messily into his mouth with his bare hands, getting expensive cream frosting all over his fingers and face. Mori stood by, watching him with a slightly worried expression. Hopefully this would satisfy the massive teen...

With an enormous belch, even louder than the previous two, Honey finished his cake, patting his abs with one hand as he did so, sitting on the ground, his clothes all but completely ripped off his body. Mori walked a few steps closer to him, noticing that Honey was nearly as tall as him sitting on the floor, and said, "Are you full now Mitsukuni?"

Honey smiled at him, cute as ever, and said

"Yeah! Play!" Honey smiled. Before Mori could have a moment to think what Honey would want to do, he was suddenly tackled to the ground! It almost felt like he was hit by a TV! "Hurt me, Takeshi? Look at me! I'm way too big to hurt! And look at these muscles!" He lifted both of his arms, and flexed them hard. They were nearly the size of bowling balls, and unless Mori's eyes were bugging out, they were still getting bigger! Hell, Honey's entire body was getting bigger! "H-He beat Mori-senpai!" Kaoru whispered to Hikaru as the two remained hidden.

1553122111211.title: Just Playing Around?

15531221112112.content:
A groan suddenly filled the air behind the nervous twins, nearly making them jump in surprise. They turned and saw Tamaki sitting up, clutching his head in one hand, his other supporting him on the floor. His deep, purple eyes landed on the pair and he smiled, relief evident on his face. "I have just had the most outrageous dream!" He said, chuckling as he got to his feet.

"Oh boy here he goes." Hikaru muttered, rolling his eyes while Kaoru shook his head sympathetically.

"I dreamed that Honey-sempai had gotten ridiculously huge and muscular just from eating cake!" Tamaki giggled to himself. "And that he was going to come after me because I had spilled coffee on Usa-chan!"

"Look on the floor." Hikaru said bluntly.

Tamaki raised an eyebrow but looked down, spotting the soiled Usa-chan almost immediately. "Oh...ARGH! So that part wasn't a dream! I really did spill coffee on Usa-chan!"

"Not to rain on your parade any more boss," Kaoru said, jerking his thumb over his shoulder at the gap in the door. "But there's something else that wasn't a dream either."

Tamaki's eyes widened in horror as he realized what Kaoru was trying to tell him. He swiftly made his way to the door and peered through the crack, nearly fainting again at the sight of the enormous Honey, standing so tall that Mori only reached his abs! "AAAAAAAAAH!" He shrieked, backing away from the door as fast as he could, tripping over Kaoru (who had been crouching down to see through the door while Hikaru remained standing) and landing rather hard on his butt. "I'm doomed! This is terrible! What are we going to do?!"

Hikaru quickly pinned Tamaki's arms down to his sides, holding him tight so he couldn't move. "First of all, we're not going to panic!"

"That's easy for you to say! Honey-sempai isn't going to step on you like a bug!" Tamaki wailed, shaking his head back and forth rapidly.

"Keep it down you two!" Kaoru whispered, waving his hands at them. "He's going to hear you!"

Hikaru and Tamaki immediately clammed up, which allowed them to hear something that made their blood run cold. "Is that Tama-chan? Is he awake?"

Kaoru peeked through the door and jumped up, rushing over to the other two. "He's coming! Hurry up! Hide Usa-chan!"

Tamaki and Hikaru began to scramble, Hikaru shoving Tamaki onto a couch so it looked like he was just waking up from his fainting spell while Kaoru grabbed Usa-chan and shoved him in a drawer. They barely managed to complete these tasks before they heard the unmistakable *thump thump thump* of Honey's footsteps directly outside of the door. With a careless gesture, Honey ripped the door off its hinges, blinking at it in cute surprise before smiling down at Mori. "Guess I don't know my own strength, huh Takeshi?~"

Mori's eyebrow twitched before he said, "Just...try to be careful Mitsukuni. Please."

"Yeah, yeah, don't worry, I will be~" Honey said with careless wave of his hand. He was clearly enjoying being the biggest of the Host Club men for once! He bent down and entered the room the twins and Tamaki were in, his broad shoulders gently rubbing against either end of the door frame. He was starting to become too huge for the school! He stood up to his full height and looked around at everyone, his eyes falling on Tamaki who was looking up at him with a slightly haggard expression, sweat standing in beads on his forehead, to Hikaru who was sitting on a different couch with his legs crossed, and finally to Kaoru who was sitting backwards on a chair near a desk, his head resting on his arms on the back of the chair. Mori squeezed in passed Honey, standing at his side, looking more like a child than the baby faced bodybuilder next to him. Honey smiled as he walked over to Tamaki, crouching down, his bulge actually shoving the couch back a few feet. Honey giggled at this while Tamaki was visibly shaking in fear.

"So, feeling better now Tama-chan?~" Honey asked, his pecs slowly inflating and deflating near Tamaki's face with his every breath.

"Y-Yes! I just need to...to lie down for awhile! I'm fine now! How...how are you doing Honey-sempai?" He asked, trying to keep the conversation light.

Honey merely grinned and flexed his monstrous biceps, each ball of muscle inflating like a pump was attached to it, thick veins running over and down the mountainous bulge. "I've never felt better! I don't know what's going on, but I like it!"

"I-I'm glad! It's always important to me that my host club members are happy! Yes, yes indeed!" Tamaki babbled, his face getting even paler, if that was possible.

Honey cocked his eyebrow and said, "Are you sure you're okay Tama-chan? You seem a little...nervous."

Tamaki immediately sprang up and clapped Honey on the shoulder, laughing unconcernedly. "Of course! I'm feeling 100% better! In fact, why don't we go back into the main music room and have some fun!"

Honey grinned and got to his feet, towering high over Tamaki, his barely contained bulge level with the Prince's face. "Yeah! That's a great idea!"

155312211121121112111.content:
As Honey sat there, still as a stuffed animal, he could only watch as his friends started to work against him. It may be true they were just trying to get things back to normal, but by doing so, they were getting in the way of his fun! Not to mention there was no telling how everyone was going to treat him after this little incident. There was almost no doubt he would be the center of pranks, insults, and even blackmail in some cases! That was the last thing he wanted! Not to mention Mori... Deep in his heart, Honey knew Mori only wanted the best for him, but what could be better for Honey than being an unstoppable force of nature? He couldn't help but feel betrayed...

Honey was about five seconds away from crying, when something new started happening within him. His gut began to gurgle once more, but no one seemed to notice at the moment. They were all gathered around Kyouya, trying to find a way to get Honey back to normal! Honey let out a whimper, slowly and soundlessly laying on his side. It felt like his blood was on fire! Little did he know it was that potion he drank earlier! Nekozawa's little brew that made him even bigger was having a reaction with the now active nanobots. Honey started to sweat, and then he began to moan, which quickly caught Mori's attention, and with him, the rest of the host club! Mori rushed right over, his hand on Honey's gigantic shoulder.

"Mitsukuni...?" He asked, looking down at him.

"I-It huuuurts..." He whined, holding onto his abs. "It hurts!" He shouted again, rolling over in pain. Everyone was looking over at Honey as he was making a commotion.

In his system, the potion forced Honey to develop antibodies, which quickly began attacking any inorganic substance within him! One by one, the hundreds of nanobots were being broken down and destroyed, having no way to defend themselves from Honey's immune system.

After a few minutes, Honey sat back up, still whimpering a little. He looked down at Mori, who was trying to hold onto his hand. Honey let out a faint smile, looking down at him. "Thanks, Takeshi." He said, grabbing him up. Kyouya immediately held up the remote in case things looked dire. Honey, in turn, just gave Mori a little kiss on the forehead. Mori just looked aside, a slight blush on his face.

"Hey, uh..." Tamaki whispered, getting closer to Kyouya. "Do we have anything for Honey to wear? It's getting a little awkward to have to stare at a naked child this much..."

As if his answer, the doors the opened up, and several men came in, carrying a huge, pink speedo with a cute little bunny on the front. Kyouya just chuckled, pushing his glasses up. "Already done."

As Honey saw the men enter, his attention was soon caught by the new article of clothing! "Wow! That's so cute!" He said happily, taking it away from the men. Slowly, he started to put it on, proving difficult in such a tiny room. It fit perfectly, nice and snug, especially right around where his bulge was. You could barely see the outline of his beast, but there was no questioning the immense girth within! Honey giggled cutely, patting it. It was nice and warm!

"Hey Tama-chan, check this out!" Honey said, grabbing Tamaki quite suddenly. Tamaki struggled for a moment, before he realized there was no reason to fear. They had the remote after all! "Look at this thingy! Isn't it cute?" Honey asked with a smile.

Tamaki let out an awkward smile. "Well, it certainly suits your tastes!" He replied. Honey giggled, before stretching out in the room.

That's when things went from peaceful to worse. Honey accidentally hit Hikaru, and was pinning him against the wall with his foot! Hikaru whined and tried his best to push back. "M-Make him stop!" Hikaru demanded. Kaoru took the remote and fiddled with it, trying to get his foot off. He casually pushed a button... Then he pressed it a little harder... Then he pressed it repeatedly. Before he knew it, he was mashing every button on the remote, trying to get SOMETHING to happen!

"K-Kyouya, it's not working!" Kaoru said, holding out the remote.

"That's impossible." He replied casually. He took the remote, but before he knew it, he found himself in the same position as Kaoru was! "This can't be good..." He mumbled. "I don't know how and I don't know what, but the remote isn't having any effect anymore!"

"What do you mean? Do you need to change the batteries? Is it on?" Kaoru inquired.

"No, no..." Kyouya replied, "Everything it working at optimal speed... But now Honey is out of our control!" Kyouya announced. Both boys froze with displeasure. Luckily, Honey stopped stretching and Hikaru was soon freed. Honey looked down at the other boys, smiling sweetly.

"Whatcha guys talking about over there?" He asked. The three of them froze, not moving an inch. Mori quickly picked up on what this meant, but Tamaki remained clueless. As Mori left Honey's side, Honey just looked down at Tamaki. "What's going on, Tama-chan?" He asked, a slight frown on his face. Tamaki didn't find the frown as scary as he used to.

"Oh, I'm sure it's nothing!" He said with a smile, "The boys are just working on a way to get you back to normal!"

"I don't wanna be normal again..." Honey said, frowning even bigger than before. While Tamaki had a strong sense of what was right and wrong, Honey's saddening frown really struck a nerve with him.

"B-But Honey-senpai, you..." Tamaki just looked up at Honey, who looked sadder by the second. "But we have to, or else you'll..." Tamaki started to feel his own sadness welling up within him. "But I..." Honey looked on the verge of crying, his eyes starting to get all wet. "I-I... I'll talk to them!" Tamaki said, turning and running off.

As Tamaki ran, Honey's eyes dried right up. He got a mischevious grin on his face as Tamaki ran off. "You always were a sucker!" Honey thought deviously to himself.

15532.title: Pokemon Men -- Ash Ketchum

155321.content:
It was a brilliant, shining day in the Kanto region. We find our hero Ash Ketchum in the neighboring city of Viridian, doing a little bit of shopping.

"Now Ash, I need you to head to Viridian City and pick a few things up for me!" Ash could recall his mother saying.

"But why can't I just head down the street?" Ash asked. He wasn't trying to get out of fufilling his mother's request, nor was he too lazy, he was just genuinely curious as to why he had to go all the way to Viridian City when there was a market just up the street.

"Ash, isn't it obvious!? Our cute little town doesn't carry the same things Viridian City does! Now here's the money, be sure to get back here by dinner!"

Ash sighed as he looked through the aisles of the store. Usually when he visited home he got to just lounge around. It was a nice change of pace for him! However, he supposed it couldn't hurt to just do ONE little thing for his mom...

"Pikaaaa!" Pikachu cried out, looking happily at his friend. Ash just chuckled and pet the little yellow guy on his head.

As Ash wandered, his eye was caught by something new. He pulled the jar off the shelf and looked at it. "Oh, hey! It's some of that protein stuff!" Ash said aloud. "I didn't know they sold it here..." He looked over at Pikachu, who was focused on the jar. "You know, I've seen this stuff around before... People say it's supposed to make Pokemon stronger... It couldn't hurt to buy one for Pikachu, right?" Ash thought to himself. The little guy deserved a treat! Ash then took a look at the price tag. His jaw immediately dropped. "9800P!?" He thought, his eyes staring wide at it. He gulped. He would have to dip into his own personal funds, but... If it was for Pikachu, then it had to be worth it!

Ash took the groceries, as well as a few other sundries his mom wanted, to the front counter along with the jar of protein. Ash could feel a sweatdrop as he saw that price ring up, but he paid it out, and was soon on his way.

As the young man walked home, Pikachu was at his side, walking on his own hind legs. Ash smiled at Pikachu, who in turn, returned the gesture.

"Why not?" Ash thought suddenly to himself. "Hey, Pikachu! Did you want a snack?" Ash asked. He pulled out the jar. Pikachu's ears perked up, as a cute smile came across his face! His hands reached up, smiling happily. After peeling the plastic off and opening the jar, Ash took out one of the pills and handed it to his friend. Pikachu immediately popped it in his mouth and let out a happy cry.

"Chaaaaaa!" He went, doing a little spin as he did. Ash just laughed.

"Wow! These must be really good!" He said with a big smile on his face. He lifted the jar to his nose and took a little whiff. They smelled just like cookies! Ash found that as a surprise. Most Pokemon food just smelled like... Well, Pokemon food. Did this mean Pokemon also like human food?

Ash shrugged. He picked a pill up out for himself, and popped it in his mouth. Chewing it up, his eyes suddenly went wide. He jumped up, pumping his fist into the air! "Whoa, those really are amazing!" Ash laughed happily. He took another two out, one for Pikachu, one for him, and the two had another! They jumped and celebrated together, the flavors sending pleasure throughout their bodies, as they could feel fresh energy within them! Ash tucked the bottle away back in the bag, and looked down at Pikachu.

"Hey buddy, race you home!" He said, looking determined. Pikachu held up his little fists and nodded.

"Pika!" With that little phrase, Ash made a dash for home, catching Pikachu off guard. Pikachu soon chased after him, catching up in due time.

One thing that Ash didn't realize was that those little "snacks" were vitamins for Pokemon. Any breeder could easily tell you they were used to make Pokemon stronger! And any one of them could tell you that if a powerful little Pokemon needed a huge dose just to get stronger, there was no telling how much it could amplify a human!

1553211.content:
Ash felt so full of energy that he was able to run all the way home from Viridian City without stopping to catch his breath once! Pikachu did a pretty good job keeping up, running along on all fours, but he couldn't compete with Ash's longer legs. Ash slapped the front door and turned, grinning down at Pikachu. "I won!"

Pikachu, fell onto his butt, panting, but he smiled up at Ash. "Pika!"

Ash scooped Pikachu up and set him on his shoulder. "Good race little guy! You deserve a rest!"

Pikachu curled up in a little ball and quickly fell asleep. Ash set the groceries down on top of the table and peeked his head into the living room. "Mom? I'm back!"

Delia looked away from her game show and up at Ash in surprise. "Ash? You're back from Viridian City already? Did someone give you a ride?"

"Nope! Just ran there!" Ash said with a grin. He dropped some money in his mother's hand and said, "I'm going upstairs to get on my PC! Call me when dinner's ready!"

Ash grabbed the bottle of Protein out of one of the bags and ran upstairs to his room. He still felt like he was surging with energy! Delia smiled and tucked the money back into her purse. "That son of mine~ He's such a surprising boy!"

She turned back to her program only for it to suddenly change to an anchorwoman, the words "Emergency Bulletin" blinking at the top of the screen in bright red letters. "This just in! A cache of experimental Pokemon food has accidentally been released into stores all over the world! The food was created as part of an experiment to make the food palatable for human consumption for the benefit of making a stronger, healthier alternative to regular vitamins. However, the food was still in its testing stages and is highly dangerous. Any human who eats the food will find their bodies drastically changed depending on what was consumed. The food is safe for Pokemon consumption and will not give them any greater benefits than what they would normally get from food. If you find any of the experimental food, contact the nearest Pokemon laboratory immediately! If any of your Pokemon's food has the distinct smell of baked goods, it is experimental."

The anchorwoman repeated the message once more before the regularly scheduled show popped back on. "Oh my! I'd better check our pantry!"

As Delia quickly began searching the pantry, Ash popped another pill into his mouth, loving the taste, while he checked his messages. He had gotten a few e-mails from his friends around the world, checking in with him to see how he was doing, telling him about their own lives, and, occasionally, inviting him to come visit. Ash smiled as he replied to them. It was good to know so many people cared about him~

The day passed fairly quickly and uneventfully. Ash ate dinner and his mother declined to tell Ash about the experimental Pokemon food. Their store of Pokemon food smelled the same as it always did so she thought they were perfectly safe and the matter passed from her mind. Ash ate a bit more than he usually did, keeping Mr. Mime busy running back and forth between the kitchen and the dining room to bring him more food. When he was done eating, he sighed, patting his slightly swollen belly. "That was great! I haven't had food that tasted that good in awhile!"

His mother smiled and said, "It's good to have you home again for awhile Ash~"

Ash yawned and said, "It's good to be back home Mom~" He stood up and stretched, turning towards the stairs. "I'm going to go to bed now. See you tomorrow!"

"Good night Ash~ I love you!" His mother called out.

"Love you too!" He called back before closing the door to his room. He was too tired to change into his pajamas so he settled for pulling off his vest and peeling his socks off, tossing them into the corner. He set his hat down on his desk and crawled into bed, falling asleep almost immediately after closing his eyes.

However, something was changing inside of Ash. The Protein that he had eaten was rushing through his system, altering his biochemistry and improving his body, specifically his muscles. It began in his chest, the once flat plain of flesh slowly pushing out, swelling thicker and rounder, the muscles pressing up against his black shirt. His shoulders broadened while his back flared out, the shirt coming untucked as the material stretched and groaned. His biceps were next, his once unimpressive arms bulging out, the muscles growing to the size of baseballs while his forearms thickened, increasing his grip. His shirt pulled up slightly as his ab muscles popped out one by one, transforming his stomach into a series of tight bumps. Down below, his pants bulged and warped as his stick thin legs bloated with size, his jeans popping their seams around his thighs, revealing his boxer shorts underneath. His calves went through a similar transformation, ripping the hems slightly as they rode up. Lastly, his butt grew rounder, firmer and more muscular while his dick shot out a few more inches, his balls swelling to match.

Ash, completely unaware of his growth, merely turned over onto his side, a small smile on his face.

Ash, unaware of all these changes, merely winced and rearranged himself. His eyes widened as he felt his bulge, the ponderous weight hanging from his crotch finally getting his attention. 15532221.content:
Gary Oak had grown to be a fine young man, following in his grandfather's footsteps to become a Pokemon Professor! Gary Oak was already out and about, and had began taking notes on various Pokemon throughout the land! It was this very journey that had led him to the Rocky Cave mountains of Kanto.

Gary was squatted down, hiding behind some rocks as he took notes on an Elekid interacting with a Geodude! Rocky Cave was, after all, located near the powerplant, so it wasn't unheard of to see an electric type coexisting with the ground types of the mountains! From what Gary could tell, they were just making idle chatter, that is, until the Elekid handed over a few berries to Geodude! The Geodude seemed quite happy, and gave Elekid some well-polished rocks in return! Fascinated, Gary began to jot down this behaviour, and was able to learn from it! It went on for a while, Gary watching the two in private, studying their every move! It was strange how something some people could find boring, Gary was so enthralled by! So enthralled, in fact, that he hadn't even noticed a shadow creeping up behind him! Gary had just finished a sentance on his paper, before he was suddenly snatched up by a pair of hands! He dropped his pencil and pad, and most importantly, his Pokeballs too!

"H-Hey! What the!?" Gary said, looking around as he was suddenly hefted off the ground!

"Machooo..." A wild Machoke uttered, as it turned back around!

"H-Hey! Put me down! Please!" Gary said, at least showing respect to the Pokemon. However, he soon learned that his plea fell on deaf ears. The Machoke continued to carry Gary off to who-knew-where! Gary didn't stop struggling, but it was all proving useless against he might of the Machoke! Eventually Gary just stopped fighting, and hoped for the best...

The Machoke took Gary through the entrance to a cave, but it was not to last. Gary could see the light at the exit not to far away! Clueless where he was, he noticed two largy Hariyama standing near the exit! Once there, Machoke looked up at the two Hariyama. They, in return, looked at Gary for a moment before looking back at the Machoke and moved aside, granting entry. Gary started to wiggle once more, feeling a little uneasy about it all!

Once they were a little further in, Gary could hear the roar of a crowd! Not a crowd of humans though, Gary recognized them as the cries of Pokemon! At this point, the Machoke slung Gary over his shoulder. Gary saw a village all around him, populated with Pokemon! Before he could get a good look though, they began to go through another tunnel, this one much shorter! The Machoke kept walking, and soon Gary was able to see an entire stadium of Pokemon, all of them cheering and looking at something that was in the center stage! Gary tried to look over the Machoke's shoulder, but it was just too burly to see past!

Just as Gary was caught up in the amazement of it all, he was thrown down onto the dirt, in a circle of sorts!

"Ow! Watch it!" Gary groaned, rubbing the back of his head! He looked up at the Machoke, who then pointed a finger straight ahead! Gary turned around, and he immediately saw a Golem standing across from him. It glared right into his eyes, before squatting down. Gary pulled back a little, before the Golem rose one leg high in the air and stomping it hard into the ground! Still squatting, the Golem lifted it's other leg and did the same! Gary was a bit confused, so he looked around a little more and soon found out that he was right in the center of a sumo ring!

"... M-Me?" Gary said, pointing at himself. The Golem's stare didn't break, as he just nodded once. Gary chuckled a bit, but the Machoke suddenly picking him up and setting him on his feet made him stop instantly! Gary looked back at he Machoke, raising an eyebrow. "Uhhh..."

The Machoke looked at Gary, and was about to raise a foot, doing his best to tell Gary he had to stomp back! Gary turned back to the Golem, gulping a little! He squatted down, and did just as the Golem had done. A slightly plump Infernape arrived on the scene, his hand down, equidistant between the two.

"Infern... APE!" It shouted! Right on cue, the Golem began to charge right at Gary! Gary was nervous beyond words, as he braced himself for impact! The Golem soon hit him like a ton of bricks! He was pushed all the way to the edge of the ring, before his feet managed to stop him from falling out! Gary took the hit, holding on for as long as he could! He managed to hang in there for only about three seconds, before the Golem thrusted it's hips, pushing it's weight right into Gary and knocking him right out of the ring! As Gary fell on his back, he looked back up at the Golem, who held his somewhat stumpy arms high, proud of his feat! The crowds of Pokemon cheered, the Infernape claiming Golem the victor!

It seemed like this was the final bout of the day, because shortly after, the Pokemon started to file out of the home-crafted stadium! Gary still looked around, amazed the Pokemon were capable of producing such a landmark! Not to mention they held their own sport! As Gary gazed around, he was tapped on the shoulder. As he looked behind him, he recognized the same Golem which had knocked him down just minutes ago! It offered it's hand, which Gary gladly took. It lifted Gary back to his feet, smiling at Gary.

"Thanks." Gary said with a smile. The Golem nodded back, before turning halfway, and pointing over at a few Pokemon. Gary looked over, and near the exit, he saw two groups of Pokemon waiting there! There was a small group of Makuhita and Hariyama together in one, and in the other was an entire Machoke family, complete with two Machops, three Machokes, and even a Machamp! A bit confused, Gary looked back down at Golem. Golem looked up at Gary from the corner of it's eyes, and kept pointing between the Makuhita family and the Machop family, as if waiting for Gary's decision...

After looking at Golem one more time, Gary began walking over to...

155322212.content:
Gary was slightly intimidated by the fierce eyes of the Machop family group, each Pokemon, even the smallest among them, flexing their rather huge muscles and grinning at him. He wasn't a coward by any means but he had also been studying Pokemon long enough to know that they could be very dangerous in the right conditions. Looking over at the Makuhita group, however, looked far friendlier, with only the Hariyama looking intimidating. The soft, round looking Pokemon felt like a safer choice. Golem was growing impatient and began to push Gary closer to the two groups, urging him to pick one.

"Alright, alright! You don't have to push! Geez..." Gary said in annoyance, walking over to the Makuhita. "There! I pick these guys. So now what?"

The Machop family looked sullen and disappointed, swiftly heading out of the makeshift arena, down a different tunnel than the one that Gary had been brought in through. The Makuhita all cheered happily, the Hariyama crossing his arms and nodding approvingly. The Golem also took his leave, waving once to Gary before leaving the human alone in the group of Pokemon. Gary smiled a little uncertainly and said, "Uh..hey. So...what's up?"

He had no idea what to do or say, this whole situation completely unprecedented! Wait...Gary thought about that for a moment. In all his years of traveling, training, and studying Pokemon he had never once heard of a group of disparate Pokemon banding together to create some kind of arena separate from any humans. Wild Pokemon, fighting, together, living, together! It helped prove the thesis that wild Pokemon enjoyed battling just as much as caught Pokemon. Perhaps this whole thing was a way for Wild Pokemon to train and get better at fighting to more easily draw in humans to try and catch them. If so, why was he, a human brought into this secret world? There were too many questions but there was one thing Gary was certain of: this was a once in a lifetime opportunity and he wasn't about to waste it! Luckily, when the Golem had carried him off he hadn't lost the notebook and pen he had been using to take notes.

Before he could pull them out, however, the Makuhitas both took one of Gary's hands, dragging him down yet another tunnel, the human trainer stumbling slightly as he was pulled into the dark once again. "H-hey! Can't you guys at least TRY to explain what this is all about?" Gary fruitlessly begged, his only answer being a firm smack on the back from the Hariyama.

It didn't take long before light returned, the strange group of human and Pokemon entering a massive cave chamber, filled with primitive looking gym equipment, all made from stone, various rather rotund Pokemon, a strange pile of grey looking marshmallow or something of that nature, and a long table sagging under the weight of a massive amount of food! There was several various types of berries that Gary could identify along with human food, including huge shanks of beef, whole roasted chickens, mountains of potatoes, piles of various vegetables, entire loaves of bread, tureens of soup, dishes of butter, anything and everything a person or Pokemon could ever want! Gary felt his mouth water just looking at it, wiping his lips as he stared.

He was jerked out of his staring by the Makuhita once again, pulling him over to the corner of the cave where the massive mound of gray marshmallow was stored. When they were within ten feet of the mound it began to stir, much to Gary's surprise, a truly enormous Snorlax coming into view as he rolled over, scratching his gigantic belly and unleashing a maelstrom of a "SNOOOOOOOOOOOOORlaaaaaaaaaax..." that nearly knocked Gary over from the wind! His eyes were wide with amazement as he stared up at the biggest Snorlax he had ever seen! It had to be at least twenty feet tall, if not bigger! He could pick Gary up and swallow him down in one bite if he wanted! "Maybe this wasn't such a great choice after all..." Gary thought, gulping slightly.

"Maku! Maku! Hita, makuhita!" One of the Makuhita said, pointing at Gary.

The Snorlax stared vacantly at the Makuhita before slowly turning to look at Gary. "Snooooooor?"

"Uh...hi?" Gary said, waving a little, not sure what was expected of him.

The Snorlax stared at him before pointing at the Hariyama. "Snor."

"Hariyama! Hari, hari, hari! Yamaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa!"

The Snorlax nodded and turned back over with a tired, "Laaaaaaax...."

The Makuhitas and Hariyama all nodded and led Gary away again, this time over to the table. Gary kept looking over his shoulder, wanting to study that monumental Snorlax, but his "hosts" were having none of that. They sat him down in front of the table, setting out three stone plates. Gary looked them over, noticing that each one had a picture of a different Pokemon on it. The one furthest to the left showed a Makuhita, happily slapping his belly. The one in the middle showed a fierce Hariyama, though the perspective seemed to be from below, making him look imposing and powerful. The one on the right depicted a Snorlax, easily filling the frame, a satisfied smile on his face. "Are you asking which one I'm interested in?" Gary asked, looking between the two Makuhita.

"Maku!" They both said, nodding happily, glad he understood.

"Oh! Okay, I'm interested in that Snorlax!" He said, eagerly pointing at the right plate.

"HAAAAAAAR!" The Hariyama said, looking shocked, both Makuhita holding a hand to their open mouths.

"...Was that not the right choice?" Gary asked, confused.

The three Pokemon laughed, slapping him on the back, as though they were congratulating him on something. Gary just chuckled nervously and said, "Uh...yeah...this is great..."

The next thing he knew, a Gulpin was set down next to him, waving a stubby arm at him slightly. Gary pet the Pokemon, causing it to blush before pointing at a plate of food. Gary set it down next to the Pokemon, which opened its mouth wide, swallowing the food in one go. "Gulp." The Pokemon said, waving his arms slightly, indicating the now empty plate.

"...Okay?" Gary said, tilting his head a little.

Gulpin indicated another plate and the process repeated itself. Gulp, swallow, indicate the empty plate. It took Gary about three renditions of this before he realized what was going on. "You want me to eat, huh?"

The Gulpin nodded. Gary shrugged and filled up one of the plates with various food, eating it happily. He had no idea who was making the food but it tasted amazing! The meat was tender and juicy, the vegetables crisp and flavorful, the potatoes actually stuffed with bacon, cheese, and ranch, the bread crusty on the outside and fluffy on the inside, the soup creamy and sweet! Gary eagerly finished his plate and filled up another, eating even more! The Pokemon nodded in satisfaction, one Makuhita rubbing his shoulders, the other moving food closer to Gary. After about five plates of food Gary was stuffed, his belly sticking out slightly, raising his shirt up a little. "Woo...that was awesome!" He said happily, grinning at the Pokemon. "You guys sure know how to treat someone!"

The Hariyama merely pushed another plate of food forward, pointing at it. "Hari."

"Uh...no thanks, I'm full. Really." Gary said, patting his stomach, feeling slightly worried again.

The Hariyama shook his head, pointing at the plate. "Hari!"

Gary looked despondently down at the food and said, "But..."

"HARI!"

Wincing slightly, Gary did as he was told, eating more of the food, forcing it down his throat, his already painfully bulging stomach bulging even more! Every time he tried to stop, the Hariyama ordered him to eat more, one of the Makuhita now rubbing his belly, trying to calm him down. Gary kept mechanically eating, not wanting to get on the bad side of this powerhouse Pokemon. As he ate however...

"Damn that Salamander!" Gajeel stomped down the roads of Magnolia, a dark aura of anger surrounding the furious Dragon Slayer. Needless to say, everyone preferred to avoid him.

The result of his ire was Natsu. It was early in the morning - still is, actually - and Gajeel was enjoying his breakfast. Then Natsu had burst into the guild, feeling bored. And being Natsu, his way of relieving his boredom was to start a fight with the first person he could. And that was Gajeel.

The iron slayer was eating bacon and eggs when Natsu socked him in the mouth. A battle ensued between the two Dragon Slayers, their guild mates watching.

In the end, however, Gajeel was defeated. If that wasn't enough, the fire-breathing twat began to brag about being stronger than Gajeel.

He sulked off, being where he is now.

"Fire-spitting bastard...!" Gajeel growled. "I'm way stronger than he is - I'm supposed to be way stronger than he is!"

Gajeel paid no mind to where he walked, he just trudged along.

"I need to get stronger." Gajeel said, flexing one of his arms, grabbing the bicep with the hand of the other arm. "I need to be so strong that Salamander - no, everyone - will be nothing against me!"

Gajeel finally stopped and looked around where he was. He was standing in front of a potion shop - a seedy-looking one at that. Gajeel couldn't help but grin. This was perfect.

Gajeel slammed the door open. Even though the sun was still out in a cloudless sky, it was dark inside to potion shop. However, Gajeel could still see the many potions stacked on shelves. And the elderly-looking man behind the counter.

He was dressed in simple robes with a green wizard hat, his saggy skin hanging on his skinny, old body. His gray beard was long, leaning over the counter. He opened one eye, "What have you came here for?"

"I want a potion that can make me stronger." Gajeel said, walking to the counter.

"Really?" The old man said, widening his one open eye. "But you're already pretty strong."

"Yeah, well pretty strong ain't enough." Gajeel replied. "I want a potion that will make me strong enough to easily beat that annoying Salamander. I will pay any price."

"Oh really? Any price, you say?" The old man grinning, running his fingers through his beard. "Such a potion cannot be cheap. You will have to pay me one million Jewel."

Gajeel let out a 'Tsk' before walking away. "I'll be back in five minutes." He said, disappearing behind the door as he closed it.

As soon as he was certain that the Dragon Slayer could no longer hear him, the old man let out a burst of snickers.

What a fool! A potion that makes people stronger? Yeah right!

The truth about the old man is that he doesn't really own or work at the store; he's a scammer. It just so happened to be his luck that the old hag that owned the store had left to visit relatives in another town. And with her store unprotected, the old man used it to his advantage.

And the first customer to walk in is an idiot who would pay a giant one million for a potion that doesn't exist. It was perfect!

However, even he knew who Gajeel is. If the iron mage doesn't come back and kick his ass for a terrible potion, his guild mates will!

"I'll just run away when he leaves with the potion." The old man said to himself. "I should be safe in the next country or two. Black Steel will never find me once I'm gone."

The door was flung open. Gajeel pulled a large sack through the door, presenting it to the scam artist.

"There, here's the Jewel." Gajeel said, unaware of the old man's trap. "Now I'll be takin' my potion, please."

"Hold on right there!" The old man said, raising a honey finger to Gajeel's face. "First I need to make the potion. I cannot risk such a powerful potion just sitting on the shelves where anyone can take. Give me five minutes, and it'll be ready."

"Fine." Gajeel grumbled, propping his hand head on his hand.

The old man hopped off his stool and ran into the backroom. Inside the room was a large cauldron and many other potions; some were simple potions that would change the colour of your hair, others were obviously rare - they're probably made by ingredients that only S Class mages can receive.

But he didn't care - they're not his problem.

The geezer poured random bottles, ranging from the aforementioned simple and rare potions, stirring them around that make them mix.

"Hey! I don't have all day!" Gajeel barked impatiently. "Get with the damn potion already!"

"J-just a minute~!" The old man sang back. He looked down at the concoction he made; a large, light blue-coloured liquid sitting in the cauldron.

Nor did he know that the remaining potion in the cauldron would also be used later in this day that would change everything.

"Here it is, just as ordered~!" The old man sang, handing the potion over to him.

"Thanks." Gajeel grinned as he looked at the elixir in his hand. "I can't wait to see the look on Salanander's face I drink this and kick his ass all the way to the moon. Gihihihihi!"

Gajeel left and vanished. With him gone, the old man grabbed the Jewel-filled sack and ran out of Magnolia as fast as his old, boney legs could take him.

"So long, suckers!"

-----

"Damn, I'm bored." Natsu grumbled, resting his head on his fist. "I wish something fun could happen."

"Salamander!" Gajeel roared as he kicked the guild doors open, elixir in hand. Natsu grinned; finally something fun to do! Gajeel stomped over to the pink-haired slayer. "You better beg for mercy, 'cause you won't be a match for me soon!"

"Ha! In your dreams!" Natsu laughed. The fire mage noticed a glass bottle in his hands. "What's with that?"

"Oh, this?" Gajeel responded. "Just a lil' somethin' to help me kick your ass!"

"I'd like to see that." Natsu said. "Go on, drink that, I'll be kicking your ass anyways."

"You'll be eating those words soon...!" Gajeel said. Ripping the cork off, Gajeel chugged down the blue potion entirely, to even the last, tiniest drop. Throwing the empty elixir away, Gajeel licked away the remaining drops on his lips. "Mmm, minty."

A hot warmth flowed through Gajeel, coursing throughout his bloodstream. The warmth felt better than anything Gajeel had ever known; he let out a small, pleasured moan.

"Oh yeah, here it comes!"

"BRO! NOOOOOO!" Simon shouted, sitting bolt upright in bed, his small, frail body covered in a sheen of sweat. He gasped as he looked around. White walls...that strange box that he put his clothes in...that door leading to the little room where he hung his jackets...and underneath him, a bed. Clean sheets, warm blankets...He sighed, slowly coming down from the adrenaline rush he had gotten from his nightmare. He flopped back down onto his pillow, turning on his side and looking out the window. It was raining again. Just a few days ago they would have all been stuck outside, trying to find shelter under rocks or in valleys. Now, thanks to his bro, they didn't need to worry about the weather no matter how bad it got!

Simon's heart started to beat a little faster again as he remembered the battle they had fought to earn Dai-Gunzan. Kamina had been very badly wounded and had only woken up sporadically in the last day. Usually he would wake up enough to drink some water before falling back asleep. He was lying in one of the bigger bedrooms now, his body wrapped up in bandages. Simon had spent the first two days by his bro's side, never leaving, never eating, never sleeping. Yoko had finally forced him to eat, drink, and get some sleep for his own health.

"Killing yourself isn't going to help him heal any faster!" He could still hear her voice.

Kamina was alive and recovering! He would be awake soon! The small boy kicked his covers aside and got up, quickly getting dressed. The battle last night had opened his eyes. He wasn't going to let something like that happen ever again! He was going to do whatever it took to get stronger so that he could protect his bro! So he could protect everyone!

With this unwavering determination in mind, Simon ran down the hall of Dai-Gunzan, heading for Kamina's room. Before he got there, he ran head first into Kittan who was walking in the opposite direction. "Hey! Watch where you're going small fry!"

"Oh! Sorry Kittan! I'm just in a bit of a hurry!" Simon quickly said.

Simon chuckled, sticking his tongue out at Kittan. "Jealous?"

Finally, he stuck the bit into the last hole. No matter how hard he tried, he couldn't turn it left or right. So he just shoved it in harder. That did it! Blue lines crisscrossed with the other two and the box slowly opened up.

"Hahahaha! Awesome!" Kittan said with a grin. "There's gotta be something amazing in there!"

Simon jumped up onto a chair and peered into the box. It was incredibly dusty inside. He reached in and brushed off the worst of it, a cloud rising up around him as he did so. "I...think there's something in here..."

Kittan tried to look inside too, but Simon was blocking his view. "Well? What is it?"

In answer, Simon pulled something out of the box, setting it down on top of the table as he did so. Kittan scratched his head and said, "What...is that?"

Simon looked it over and said, "I think it's a...

"Demon?! How dare you! I may be of a... Darker descent, but how could you say I'm a demon when you're gazing upon such beauty!? My iridecent wings, my slender legs, and not to mention these svelte arms!" The now narcissitic fairy rambled on.

"All this work... Ruined! I could handle it when the ogre ran through, or when that grotesque ghost woman stole one from me, but this... This!" The fairy's fist closed tight in blistering fury. "I hope those curses get back each and every one of them tenfold!"

"You are a little treat, you know that?" He asked, "Who thought someone so beautiful could be so destructive? But I digress... I think I'll lay a special curse on you, my little biscuit. And even as a treat, I'll send you back where you came!"

Yusuke looked up, but just as he did, a golden dust sparkled all around him. He tried fanning it away, but there was just too much of it! Yusuke soon started to feel very sleepy, and in but seconds, he collapsed on the forest floor!
